comments.commentBody: The difference being that the confederacy was so abysmally wrong.

No Lucky Dog.  The Wampanoag Nation here in Massachusetts, the ones the Pilgrim Separatists first encountered, view Thanksgiving as their day of national mourning.  Thanksgiving is not inclusive of Native Americans.  It is still Norman Rockwell's white people sitting down to a huge dinner.  No Injuns need apply.

The United States exists because Native Americans were pushed off their land.  Sad to say, this is yet one more article in the current NY Times' editors' march to revise history regarding one race only. Frankly, we are sick of it. Diversity does not mean only one race in your articles, your editorials, your magazine. So get back on your soapbox and write about the fact that almost every symbol of this country - flags, eagles, fireworks, Fourth of July, pledge of allegiance - dishonors those pushed out due to being Native Americans, while those of other races (note the plural there, that is REAL diversity) took their lands. The sole exception is Thanksgiving, which is inclusive of the contribution of Native Americans - so NY Times, where is your article not on how we destroy the reality of history as lived by other races on this land, but how we START to include Native Americans.
I don't know where you get your information from but the south was never a "soverign country"

An irony: from long times past up into the early 1980's gay men knew that, in southern towns, the most likely place to hook up with another gay man was at the "southern side" of the rebel memorial statue, usually after 9 pm. I know, because I created software for horse breeders throughout the south in that era and I learned "the rules."

The iconography of southern soldier memorial statues (usually not the rich and powerful officers, but rather of the dirt scrabbling, poor, non-slave owning, loyal onto death to their state, fierce, beautiful, lost young men) is one of the great tragic unbalanced treasures of USAian history. For balance they need statues of the slaves who served the masters of both the poor whites and the terrifying ranks of the enslaved blacks.

The black men I met at these memorials were generous about the white soldier statues under which I met them -- "that poor boy" said one.

Seven of the 11 confederate states seceded before Lincoln was even inaugurated, so they were not waiting to negotiate a settlement. And the actual fighting began with confederates firing on union troops in Fort Sumter, not with an invasion by Lincoln. Anything else is, yes, revisionist history, and judging by many of the comments here, revisionist history is what too many people are being taught to believe.

Those monuments are memorials to men who were the victims of a southern leadership that was over-confident and rash in provoking a constitutional crisis and eventually war. And those monuments, glorifying a treasonous rebellion, are an affront not only to African-Americans but to every American who believes in our One Nation Under God.

Interesting. And what, pray tell, might those "severe repercussions" be?

Just curious.

These statutes are all over Georgia, too, and are typically in the center of a courthouse square. Just as talk continues of putting an MLK memorial on top of the largest Confederate memorial - Stone Mountain - maybe there can be a movement to memorialize the Civil Rights in the courthouse squares.

For heaven's sake people. Leave the statues and their admirers alone and pray to God they leave you alone.

Rock on Dixie!

"Wonderful and exotic India! Land of quaint hotels and zero sewage for half a billion people. Land of nukes and billionaires and poverty on such a scale that social stability is a dream for another generation."

This is unfair to India with her extra-ordinarily large population. It is easier for us Westerners to criticize and denigrate other peoples. But India is struggling mightily to overcome her many adversities. I admire what she has been able to accomplish so far. I have always thought that for her size and her diversity of religions and cultures, India is holding up very well indeed.

Disparaging other cultures is a human right. Nobody has the right to hold a culture immune from criticism. The thing that all cultures deserve to be criticized for is their very insistence on holding themselves above criticism. "We are not morally culpable for what we do, because our culture tells us to do it!" Like the Nuremberg defendants, you are only obeying orders. Your crime lies not in being obedient, but, rather, in being obedient to the wrong things. Obedience is owed to a morality that transcends all cultures, not to any culture which maintains the pretense that IT, itself, is morality. Heaven knows I can't stand Catholicism but I really loved it when Pope Francis called Capitalism a system without ethics. If Capitalism is not sacrosanct, if it is an ox that we are free to gore, so let be India's caste system and Hinduism, and Islam, and Populist Christian Fundamentalism, and Zionism. In holding themselves to be ABOVE being judged morally evil, they commit the very breach by which they do most totally BECOME evil.

Ah yes, progress! A young girl is gang raped by four of her social overlords and, since there is no institutional justice for someone of her social station, has the courage to seek her own. Wonderful and exotic India! Land of quaint hotels and zero sewage for half a billion people. Land of nukes and billionaires and poverty on such a scale that social stability is a dream for another generation. If violence against women is on the modest scale of 1 in 5 like in the enlightened USA, then only 120 million Indian women have been violated and psychically destroyed.
Mr. Kristof is to be commended for his tireless commentary on this and other human rights offenses around the planet. His on going work load staggers the imagination.

" Admitting women to medical school in lieu of nursing school has enabled everyone to chose a female physician."

Wouldn't you, or anyone in the PC crowd, found it "sexist", "discriminatory" and "misogynistic" when male physicians would - like female OB-GYN do now, without being prosecuted - advertise that they, as males "better understand and welcome male patients" - loudly protest?

With all that push for "equal representation" of women and (selected, not Asian, etc.) minorities in STEM, medicine, etc. and hundreds of programs, set-asides, girls-only prep schools etc. "sending girls to college" despite the fact that 62% of all college graduates are now women and in essence no boys-only institutions and programs exist (unless one is a selected minority male) no one cries that 18-year old girls and women are "discriminated" against by being denied the opportunity to serve the country by being required to register with the Selective Service - or facing - like "privileged" male imprisonment, penalties, denial of Pell Grant and other college finacial assistance.

Why is it that tens of thousands of females in this country gains English language and cultural competitive advantage by working here - btw mostly illegally - as au pairs and why our professional Mums discriminate males, American and foreigner, from never considering them for au pair or baby sitting or nanny positions? Where are equal rights protesters?

Would you care to step out of your personal echo chamber? Yes, the same women who want to be able to choose a woman OB are more than happy to see men choosing male urologists. Or therapists, or exercise physiologists. In fact that's the point: the ability to see a doctor who might have some personal acquaintance with the problem, however generally. Until women started entering medicine in large numbers, drug testing and medical studies almost entirely excluded women, in part out of simple ignorance and arrogance. The men involved did not really believe that there would be significant differences, despite generations of women telling them otherwise. Women also suffered from the ignorance of male doctors who had never experienced physical or emotional problems common in women, and who didn't, in the end, understand what the women were talking about. The women physicians did. I expect the same is true of gendered understanding of men's ailments.

Your other arguments are equally wrongheaded.

The point you raise is one that American selective colleges have battling with at least since the 1960's. On one hand, should colleges solely focus on academic distinction expressed through grades and standardized tests. While many liberals might suggest that this idea perpetuates the advantages of the affluent, this is, in fact, how elite colleges in Europe generally select their students.

On the other hand, colleges now consider attributes beyond just academic scores including race. Princeton sociologist Espenshade found that a black applicant had the same chance of admission to a competitive college as a white student with SAT scores 310 points higher.

https://www.princeton.edu/~tje/files/webOpportunity%20Cost%20of%20Admiss...

That's a big difference. Moreover, the lower graduation rates of such students suggests such affirmative action programs may not be helping the students that were intended.

While the right answer seems to be a balance of academic criteria and other context, I believe your conclusion goes a step too far. "Training talented white men to be the mayors of our major cities is a waste of time and money. They will not be elected." Ever hear of Mayor Bloomberg or Mayor De Blasio ?

Sooner or later someone needs to define "diversity." Currently, the word has been taken over to mean race and sex and nothing else.

Selective colleges generally require successful applicants to be in the top one or two percent of high school seniors, both academically and intellectually, to be "morally sound," and to be likely to justify the heavy cost subsidies all students receive, even if they are not given "a full ride."

What has changed for newcomers is that admission officers now recognize that some "under-qualified" students are likely to have a greater impact on society as a whole than some "highly qualified" students. Like it or not, but white male doctors black list certain places where they will not practice. Goldman Sachs employees too often contribute nothing to their own communities, let alone communities in the most need. A minister to a large congregation of inner city poor probably could benefit from Yale Divinity School more than a minister to a wealthy suburban church. Admitting women to medical school in lieu of nursing school has enabled everyone to chose a female physician. Having some well-educated, if not as intellectually capable, politicians in our key inner cities is necessary. Training talented white men to be the mayors of our major cities is a waste of time and money. They will not be elected. Instead, find the future black mayors of these cities and improve metropolitan areas and many 1,000's of lives.

Sorry, can't resist. Just for fun, totally unrelated, except for deep tones, Entwistle's Boris the Spider:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vgx7abJH6uI
Marvellous video, thanks.

SS: no strategy devised by Abbas can work; it takes two to tango and Israel won't tango.

If this isn't known by now--with Netanyahoo declaring he won't abide a two-state solution--then it is deliberately not know by those who prefer to blame Palestianians for Israeli recalcitrance.

Netanyahu did not state that he would not allow a two state solution, though he probably should kill the idea. He stated he prefers a demilitarized Palestinian state alongside a Jewish state. The Palestinian position is that they will never recognize a Jewish state.

But why let facts get in the way.

To USA JUDGE: Here's what Netanyahu said in 2015: “I think that anyone who is going to establish a Palestinian state today and evacuate lands, is giving attack grounds to the radical Islam against the state of Israel,” Netanyahu said in a radio interview.

USA JUDGE can get a two state solution out of this, but most people can't. You know who can pull a rabbit out of USA JUDGE's hat? A propagandist, not an honest person.
"Let's get the facts out of the way" is what you want judge. Hope you don't put people away on such a misconstrual of the facts as you've done in your comment.

Abbas has followed in the failed footsteps of Arafat, by focusing more on winning PR points than attaining Palestinian statehood. He has done nothing to stop the violent reactions to a rumor about Israel changing rules involving prayer around the Al Aqsa Mosque, and at a minimum has tacitly approved the ensuing violence.

This follows similar failures by Arafat, who encouraged the Intifadas, which ended up depriving Palestinians of access to Israel for jobs, making their economic situation more dire, as well as increasing hostility and insecurity, thus making statehood less likely.

Abbas had the audacity to agitate further by lying about the execution of a young Palestinian who stabbed a 13 year old Israeli on a bike multiple times. His claim that this Palestinian boy was executed by Israelis, when in reality the boy was recovering in Hadassah Hospital, again demonstrated his misguided desire to win the PR battle, while losing the statehood war. Of course, haters of Israel prefer to ignore the facts and immediately condemn Israel regardless of evidence.

Take a good look at the poor strategies of the Palestinian leadership before reflexively blaming Israel for the Palestinians' present situation.

How about requiring elite institutions to begin the process of spending down their endowments?

Charitable foundations have to spend down their assets every year to justify their ongoing tax exemptions.

Schools like Harvard and Stanford seem to grow their endowments by leaps and bounds.

Sorry, can't resist. Just for fun, totally unrelated, except for deep tones, Entwistle's Boris the Spider:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vgx7abJH6uI
This is one of the best things I've ever eaten

"Also missing is the fact that no one has been caught and prosecuted after a year, which is highly unusual since Israel finds Palestinian suspects within hours or days."
The fact is the perpetrators had been caught and brought to justice in no more than the couple of weeks. Overlooking or ignoring well known facts makes your lies less effective.

The suspects were arrested shortly after the horrendous murder.
http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Abu-Khdeir-murder-suspect-recounts-gr...

But facts don't usually matter to the Israel bashers.
Also omitted from this article, and West Sider's comment, is the fact that this monstrous crime was preceded by another monstrous crime, in which three Israeli teenagers were kidnapped and murdered in cold blood.

"... since July 2014, when Jewish extremists kidnapped and murdered Muhammad Abu Khdeir...no one has been caught and prosecuted after a year..."

I draw your attention to the following from the July 20, 2014 Jerusalem Post: "The Supreme Court on Sunday night removed a gag order and permitted the publication of Yossef Haim Ben David as the adult alleged murderer of east Jerusalem teenage Muhammad Abu Khdeir.

"On Thursday, the Jerusalem District Attorney’s Office filed an indictment with the Jerusalem District Court against three Jews for the nationalist-revenge murder of Muhammad Abu Khdeir earlier in July."

I personally do not know where this "case" stands now, but I can assure you that his murderers have not been allowed to, nor will be allowed to "go scot-free." I was, as was the overwhelming majority of Israelis, horrified by this despicable act, and our government and court system (and numerous NGOs) would never agree to what the NYTimes and WestSider imply.

It would have been an excellent example of responsible, fair reporting if the NYTimes had seen fit to add a sentence after the sentence about Muhammad Abu Khdeir, that this despicable killing came on the heels of the brutal murders of three teenagers on their way home from studies at a yeshiva - lest any of the readers think that Khdeir's murderers just said, oh, well, let's go find an Arab and kill him today.

“...all the time as a Palestinian here you feel that they want to take you out of the city..”

Because everything, I mean everything they do, is precisely geared to make that happen. Only the willfully ignorant, like our media and politicians, would not state that fact. A simple daily perusal of English language Israeli papers makes that crystal clear.

"East Jerusalem has been a hotbed since July 2014, when Jewish extremists kidnapped and murdered Muhammad Abu Khdeir, a 16-year-old..”

We influence public opinion with words that matter. Words missing from the above are: burning alive and innocent. Also missing is the fact that no one has been caught and prosecuted after a year, which is highly unusual since Israel finds Palestinian suspects within hours or days.

"High scores on the SAT or ACT correlate with high family income, in part because performance on these tests can be improved with the special classes and private tutoring that money buys." Even if this is true, which some dispute, does Mr. Bruni really think this is the biggest reason for the correlation? If not, why doesn't he discuss the other, more important reasons? Would he attribute the superior jumping ability of the children of NBA players to their attending summer basketball camps?

And anyone who has witnessed the college admissions process at a diverse high school knows that elite colleges now pursue first-generation college students as enthusiastically as under-represented minorities and elite athletes. A student in any of those categories merely has to let colleges know that (through the SAT or ACT application form and the common app) and he or she will be encouraged to apply and given preference in admission over applicants that are not in one of those categories. Affluence below the level necessary to contribute a building is no longer an advantage in the application process at our top colleges, which are need blind.

It's ironic that a test created to make college admissions more meritocratic and less class based is now under threat from those who surely would have cheered its creation.

http://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2014/03/the-sat-test-pr...

http://www.brookings.edu/research/articles/1999/12/politics-toch

At the time of your visit you were but a college student, and your lack of knowledge and history can be excused. But now? Israel had already suffered 3 major wars of Arab attempts to annihilate the Jews. To "drive them into the sea" was not about getting a nice swim. It seems there's still much that goes on with Palestinian intransigence that you have not assimilated.
unfortunately, since Palestinian religion, media andeducational system continue to encourage martyrs, and the world is silent, one can expect such martyrs to continue to attack Jews.
No doubt because of Crimea's recent and unprovoked war of aggression against Russia.  Somehow I can't recall when that occurred.  When was that, exactly?
East Jerusalem is the center of the Jewish land that has been the traditional home for Jews for thousands of years before the term "Palestine" was coined or Muhammad was born.
Perhaps because they did come from all over the world and took everything they had by force?
Thanks for the good work Reed.
Palestinians living in Israel are treated MUCH better than Jews living in many Muslim countries.
They are a pariah only in the eyes of Muslims and leftists primarily on college campuses.  Israel is a model of productivity, civility and tolerance in an extremely hostile neighborhood.
